nodes.label: Asset bubble
nodes.description: Unsustainably overpriced assets such as commodities, housing, shares, etc. in a major economy or region.

nodes.label: Deflation
nodes.description: Prolonged ultra-low inflation or deflation in a major economy or region.

nodes.label: Failure of financial mechanism or institution
nodes.description: Prolonged ultra-low inflation or deflation in a major economy or region.

nodes.label: Failure of critical infrastructure
nodes.description: Failure to adequately invest in, upgrade and secure infrastructure networks (e.g. energy, transportation and communications) leads to pressure or a breakdown with system-wide implications.

nodes.label: Fiscal crises
nodes.description: END  Failure to adequately invest in, upgrade and secure infrastructure networks (e.g. energy, transportation and communications) leads to pressure or a breakdown with system-wide implications.

nodes.label: Unemployment or underemployment
nodes.description: A sustained high level of unemployment or underutilization of the productive capacity of the employed population prevents the economy from attaining high levels of employment.

nodes.label: Illicit trade
nodes.description: Large-scale activities outside the legal framework such as illicit financial flow, tax evasion, human trafficking, counterfeiting and organized crime undermine social interactions, regional or international collaboration and global growth.

nodes.label: Energy price shock
nodes.description: Energy price increases or decreases significantly and places further economic pressures on highly energy-dependent industries and consumers.

nodes.label: Unmanageable inflation
nodes.description: Unmanageable increase in the general price level of goods and services in key economies.

nodes.label: Extreme weather events
nodes.description: Major property, infrastructure and environmental damage as well as human loss caused by extreme weather events.

nodes.label: Failure of climate-change mitigation and adaptation
nodes.description: Governments and businesses fail to enforce or enact effective measures to mitigate climate change, protect populations and help businesses impacted by climate change to adapt.

nodes.label: Biodiversity loss and ecosystem collapse
nodes.description: Irreversible consequences for the environment, resulting in severted resources for humankind as well as industries.

nodes.label: Natural catastrophes
nodes.description: Major property, infrastructure and environmental damage as well as human loss causphysical disasters such as earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, tsunamis or geomagnetic storms.

nodes.label: Man-made environmental catastrophes
nodes.description: Failure to prevent major man-made catastrophes, causing harm to lives, human health, infrastructure, property, economic activity and the environment.

nodes.label: Failure of national governance
nodes.description: Inability to govern a nation of geopolitical importance due to weak rule of law, corruption or political deadlock.

nodes.label: Interstate conflict
nodes.description: A bilateral or multilateral dispute between states escalates into economic (e.g. trade/currency wars, resource nationalization), military, cyber, societal or other conflict.

nodes.label: Terrorist attacks
nodes.description: Individuals or non-state groups with political or religious goals successfully inflict large-scale human or material damage.

nodes.label: State collapse or crisis
nodes.description: State collapse of geopolitical importance due to internal violence, regional or global instability, military coup, civil conflict, failed states, etc.

nodes.label: Weapons of mass destruction
nodes.description: Nuclear, chemical, biological and radiological technologies and materials are deployed creating international crises and potential for significant destruction.

nodes.label: Failure of urban planning
nodes.description: Nuclear, chemical, biological and radiological technologies and materials are deployed creating international crises and potential for significant destruction.

nodes.label: Food crises
nodes.description: Access to appropriate quantities and quality of food and nutrition becomes inadequate, unaffordable or unreliable on a major scale.

nodes.label: Large-scale involuntary migration
nodes.description: Access to appropriate quantities and quality of food and nutrition becomes inadequate, unaffordable or unreliable on a major scale.

nodes.label: Profound social instability
nodes.description: Major social movements or protests (e.g. street riots, social unrest, etc.) disrupt political or social stability, negatively impacting populations and economic activity.

nodes.label: Spread of infectious diseases
nodes.description: Bacteria, viruses, parasites or fungi cause uncontrolled spread of infectious diseases (for instance due to resistance to antibiotics, antivirals and other treatments) leading to widespread fatalities and economic disruption.

nodes.label: Water crises
nodes.description: A significant decline in the available quality and quantity of fresh water resulting in harmful effects on human health and/or economic activity.

nodes.label: Adverse consequences of technological advances
nodes.description: Intended or unintended adverse consequences of technological advances such as artificial intelligence, geo-engineering and synthetic biology causing human, environmental and economic damage.

nodes.label: Critical information infrastructure breakdown
nodes.description: Cyber dependency increases vulnerability to outage of critimation infrastructure (e.g. internet, satellites, etc.) and networks causing widespread disruption.

nodes.label: Cyberattacks
nodes.description: Large-scale cyberattacks or malware causing large economic damages, geopolitical tensions or widespread loss of trust in the Internet.

nodes.label: Data fraud or theft
nodes.description: Wrongful exploitation of private or official data that takes place on an unprecedented scale.

nodes.label: Ageing population
nodes.description: Ageing populations in developed and developing countries driven by declining fertility and decrease of middle and old age mortality.

nodes.label: Changing landscape of international governance
nodes.description: Changing landscape of global or regional institutions (e.g.  UN, IMF, NATO, etc.), agreements or networks.

nodes.label: Climate change
nodes.description: Change of climate which is attributed directly or indirectly to human activity that alters the composition of the global atmosphere, in addition to natural climate variability.

nodes.label: Environmental degradation
nodes.description: Deterioration in the quality of air, soil and water from ambient concentrations of pollutants and other activities and processes.

nodes.label: Growing middle class in emerging economies
nodes.description: Growing share of population reaching middle-class income levels in emerging economies.

nodes.label: Increasing national sentiment
nodes.description: Increasing national sentiment among populations and political leaders affecting countries??? national and international political positions.

nodes.label: Increasing polarization of societies
nodes.description: Inability to reach agreement on key issues within countries because of diverging or extreme values, political or religious views.

nodes.label: Rise of chronic diseases
nodes.description: Increasing rates of non-communicable diseases, also known as chronic diseases, leading to long-term costs of treatment and threatening recent societal gains in life expectancy and quality.

nodes.label: Rise of cyber dependency
nodes.description: Rise of cyber dependency due to increasing digital interconnection of people, things and organizations.

nodes.label: Rising geographic mobility
nodes.description: Increasing mobility of people and things due to quicker and better-performing means of transport and lowered regulatory barriers.

nodes.label: Rising income and wealth disparity
nodes.description: Increasing socioeconomic gap between rich and poor in major countries or regions.

nodes.label: Shifts in power
nodes.description: Shifting power from state to non-state actors and individuals, from global to regional levels, and from developed to emerging market and developing economies.

nodes.label: Urbanization
nodes.description: Rising number of people living in urban areas resulting in physical growth of cities.
